intro: Polycarpaea candida, commonly known as the white-flowered polycarpaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white flowers. The plant produces multiple flowers along its stems, which are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Polycarpaea candida is typically found in shaded, moist habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
